category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/009 Chapter 9 Social Media Information Systems

name.text: q001 ________ is the use of information technology to support the sharing of con

questiontext.text: ________ is the use of information technology to support the sharing of content among networks of users.

name.text: q002 Which of the following statements is a characteristic of social media (SM)

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is a characteristic of social media (SM) user communities?

answer.text: SM user communities are mostly based on geographic and familial ties.
Most users of SM belong to several different user communities.
In community SM site relationships, the relationships in second-tier communities are disassociated from first-tier users.
A viral hook is an inducement to constrain communications between user communities.

name.text: q003 Social media (SM) communities differ from regular communities because _____

questiontext.text: Social media (SM) communities differ from regular communities because ________.

answer.text: they are based on mutual interests of users
they are based only on organizational boundaries
most people belong to a single community
the total number of its users is determined by the sum of the sizes of all its communities

name.text: q004 Platforms that enable the creation of social networks, or social relationsh

questiontext.text: Platforms that enable the creation of social networks, or social relationships among people with common interests, are offered by social media ________.

name.text: q005 Social media (SM) ________ utilize SM sites to build social relationships.

questiontext.text: Social media (SM) ________ utilize SM sites to build social relationships.

name.text: q006 Social media (SM) ________ are formed based on mutual interests and transce

questiontext.text: Social media (SM) ________ are formed based on mutual interests and transcend familial, geographic, and organizational boundaries.

name.text: q007 Which of the following statements is TRUE about viral hooks in a social med

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about viral hooks in a social media (SM) site?

answer.text: It is used to restrain information leaks from an organization.
It is used to enhance an organization's privacy on its SM sites.
It is designed to root out users who post junk content on an organization's SM site.
It is an inducement to pass communication along the tiers of a community.

name.text: q008 Which of the following statements is TRUE of social media (SM) providers?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of social media (SM) providers?

answer.text: They do not support custom software for long durations as it is expensive.
They generally charge users a license fee to use their applications.
They use elastic, cloud-based servers to host SM presence.
They sponsor content on SM sites.

name.text: q009 ________ refers to data and responses to data that are contributed by users

questiontext.text: ________ refers to data and responses to data that are contributed by users and SM sponsors.

name.text: q010 ________ is data about relationships.

questiontext.text: ________ is data about relationships.

name.text: q011 A Facebook user likes pages of various organizations on Facebook. The fact

questiontext.text: A Facebook user likes pages of various organizations on Facebook. The fact that the user has liked a particular organization is an example of ________.

name.text: q012 In the context of the five components of social media information systems (

questiontext.text: In the context of the five components of social media information systems (SMIS), which of the following statements is TRUE of social media (SM) providers?

answer.text: They usually process SM sites using desktops, laptops, and smartphones.
They store and retrieve SM data on behalf of users.
They employ browsers and native mobile applications to store and retrieve connection data.
They are informal, evolving, and socially oriented.

name.text: q013 In the context of the five components of social media information systems (

questiontext.text: In the context of the five components of social media information systems (SMIS), which of the following statements is TRUE of social media (SM) procedures?

answer.text: They process SM sites using elastic, cloud-based servers.
Organizations develop and operate their own custom, proprietary, social networking application software.
Informality makes SMIS difficult to use.
They are informal, evolving, and socially oriented.

name.text: q014 Social media enables people to form communities, which are groups of people

questiontext.text: Social media enables people to form communities, which are groups of people related by a common interest.

name.text: q015 A social media information system is an information system that supports th

questiontext.text: A social media information system is an information system that supports the sharing of content among networks of users.

name.text: q016 Social media communities develop and operate their own custom, proprietary,

questiontext.text: Social media communities develop and operate their own custom, proprietary, social networking application software.

name.text: q017 Social media communities are the companies that operate social media (SM) s

questiontext.text: Social media communities are the companies that operate social media (SM) sites.

name.text: q018 Facebook, Google+, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, and Pinterest are examples

questiontext.text: Facebook, Google+, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, and Pinterest are examples of social media providers that enable the creation of social networks.

name.text: q019 Social media providers create the features and functions of the site, and t

questiontext.text: Social media providers create the features and functions of the site, and they compete with one another for the attention of users.

name.text: q020 Social media users include only individuals and not organizations that use

questiontext.text: Social media users include only individuals and not organizations that use social media sites.

name.text: q021 Organizations create and manage social media (SM) accounts just like typica

questiontext.text: Organizations create and manage social media (SM) accounts just like typical users.

name.text: q022 Some companies hire staff to maintain their social media (SM) presence, pro

questiontext.text: Some companies hire staff to maintain their social media (SM) presence, promote their products, build relationships, and manage their image.

name.text: q023 Depending on how an organization wants to use social media, it can be a use

questiontext.text: Depending on how an organization wants to use social media, it can be a user, a provider, or both.

name.text: q024 Social media providers develop and operate their own custom, proprietary, s

questiontext.text: Social media providers develop and operate their own custom, proprietary, social networking application software.

name.text: q025 Content data is data about relationships.

questiontext.text: Content data is data about relationships.

name.text: q026 Connection data differentiates social media.

questiontext.text: Connection data differentiates social media.

name.text: q027 Web sites and social networking sites both present user and responder conte

questiontext.text: Web sites and social networking sites both present user and responder content, but only social networking applications store and process connection data.

name.text: q028 Social media (SM) application providers store and retrieve SM data on behal

questiontext.text: Social media (SM) application providers store and retrieve SM data on behalf of users.

name.text: q029 For social networking users, procedures are informal, evolving, and sociall

questiontext.text: For social networking users, procedures are informal, evolving, and socially oriented.

name.text: q030 Informality in procedures means that unintended consequences are common in

questiontext.text: Informality in procedures means that unintended consequences are common in social media.

name.text: q031 Social media is creating new job titles, new responsibilities, and the need

questiontext.text: Social media is creating new job titles, new responsibilities, and the need for new types of training.

name.text: q032 What is social media?

questiontext.text: What is social media?

graderinfo.text: Social media (SM) is the use of information technology to support the sharing of content among networks of users. Social media enables people to form communities of practice, or communities that are groups of people related by a common interest. A social media information system (SMIS) is an information system that supports the sharing of content among networks of users.

name.text: q033 Who are social media (SM) users?

questiontext.text: Who are social media (SM) users?

graderinfo.text: Social media (SM) users include both individuals and organizations that use SM sites to build social relationships. Hundreds of millions of individuals visit SM sites on a regular basis, and they do so in several ways. Organizations are SM users too. One may not think of an organization as a typical user, but in many ways it is. Organizations create and manage SM accounts just like typical users.

name.text: q034 What are social media (SM) providers?

questiontext.text: What are social media (SM) providers?

graderinfo.text: Social media (SM) providers are the companies that operate the SM sites. Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Google are all SM providers. They provide platforms that enable the creation of social networks, or social relationships among people with common interests. They develop and operate their own custom, proprietary, social networking application software and compete with one another for the attention of users.

name.text: q035 Explain the hardware component of social media information systems (SMIS) w

questiontext.text: Explain the hardware component of social media information systems (SMIS) with respect to each of the three organizational roles.

graderinfo.text: Both community users and employees process social media (SM) sites using desktops, laptops, smartphones, iPads, HTML 5 devices, and, indeed, any intelligent communications device. In most cases, SM application providers host the SM presence using elastic servers in the cloud.

name.text: q036 Explain the software component of social media information systems (SMIS) w

questiontext.text: Explain the software component of social media information systems (SMIS) with respect to each of the three organizational roles.

graderinfo.text:
Social media (SM) users employ browsers and client applications to communicate with other users, send and receive content, and add and remove connections to communities and other users. These include desktop and mobile applications for a variety of platforms, including iOS, Android, and Windows.
SM application providers develop and operate their own custom, proprietary, social networking application software. Supporting such custom software is expensive over the long term, but SM application vendors must do so because the features and functions of their applications are fundamental to their competitive strategy.

name.text: q037 Explain the data component of social media information systems (SMIS).

questiontext.text: Explain the data component of social media information systems (SMIS).

graderinfo.text: Social media (SM) data falls into two categories: content and connection. Content data is data and responses to data that are contributed by users. Connection data is data about relationships. Connection data differentiates SMIS from Web site applications. Both Web sites and social networking sites present user and responder content, but only social networking applications store and process connection data. SM application providers store and retrieve SM data on behalf of sponsors and user communities.

name.text: q038 Explain the procedure component of social media information systems (SMIS)

questiontext.text: Explain the procedure component of social media information systems (SMIS) with respect to a user and an organization.

graderinfo.text: For social networking users, procedures are informal, evolving, and socially oriented. One does what their friends do. Such informality makes using SMIS easy; it also means that unintended consequences are common. The most troubling examples concern user privacy. For organizations, social networking procedures are more formalized and aligned with an organization's strategy. Organizations develop procedures for creating content, managing user responses, removing obsolete or objectionable content, and extracting value from content. For example, setting up an SMIS to gather data on product problems is a wasted expense unless procedures exist to extract knowledge from that social networking data. Organizations also need to develop procedures to manage SM risk.

name.text: q039 Explain the people component of social media information systems (SMIS) wit

questiontext.text: Explain the people component of social media information systems (SMIS) with respect to a user and an organization.

graderinfo.text: Users of social media (SM) do what they want to do depending on their goals and their personalities. They behave in certain ways and observe the consequences. They may or may not change their behavior. SM users aren't necessarily rational, at least not in purely monetary ways. Organizations cannot be so casual. Anyone who uses his or her position in a company to speak for an organization needs to be trained on both SMIS user procedures and the organization's social networking policy.

name.text: q040 Social media's flow cannot be designed or diagrammed as it is very ________

questiontext.text: Social media's flow cannot be designed or diagrammed as it is very ________.

name.text: q041 Value chains determine ________.

questiontext.text: Value chains determine ________.

name.text: q042 Which of the following statements is TRUE of social customer relationship m

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of social customer relationship management (CRM)?

answer.text: Relationships between organizations and customers are unchanging.
Each customer crafts his or her own relationship with a company.
Sales managers can control what a customer is reading about a company and its products.
Customers who are likely to make the highest purchases are likely to receive the most attention.

name.text: q043 ________ is a dynamic social media process of employing users to participat

questiontext.text: ________ is a dynamic social media process of employing users to participate in product design or product redesign.

name.text: q044 Since its inception, social media (SM) has been widely used to market produ

questiontext.text: Since its inception, social media (SM) has been widely used to market products to end users in ________.

answer.text: improving communication channels within an organization

name.text: q045 A(n) ________ social networking service like Yammer can be used to provide

questiontext.text: A(n) ________ social networking service like Yammer can be used to provide managers with real-time feedback about how to resolve internal operational inefficiencies.

name.text: q046 Which of the following is a use of social media (SM) in human resources?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a use of social media (SM) in human resources?

answer.text: It is used to determine performance incentives.
It is used to keep track of employees' personal lives.
It is used for recruiting candidates.
It is used for terminating employees.

name.text: q047 Internal personnel social media sites such as MySite and MyProfile in Share

questiontext.text: Internal personnel social media sites such as MySite and MyProfile in SharePoint and other similar enterprise systems are used for ________.

name.text: q048 Which of the following indicates a risk of using social media in human reso

questiontext.text: Which of the following indicates a risk of using social media in human resources?

answer.text: recruiting employees for vacant jobs only through social media and not otherwise
determining employee performance through social media
probing employee personal and social life through social media
making errors in forming conclusions about employees through social media

name.text: q049 Which of the following statements is TRUE of using social media to advance

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of using social media to advance organizational strategies?

answer.text: The unpredictability of dynamic processes like social media is encouraged in supply chains.
Solving supply chain problems via social media reinforces an organization's sense of privacy.
Users who have no financial incentive are willing to provide reviews to the buyer community.
Organizations who sell to developer networks are the last to adopt SM-based customer support.

name.text: q050 Value chains determine unstructured business processes.

questiontext.text: Value chains determine unstructured business processes.

name.text: q051 Social media (SM) is by its very nature static.

questiontext.text: Social media (SM) is by its very nature static.

name.text: q052 Social media's flow cannot be designed or diagrammed easily. Even if it was

questiontext.text: Social media's flow cannot be designed or diagrammed easily. Even if it was to be designed, the social media process would have changed even before the diagram is finished.

name.text: q053 Social media fundamentally changes the balance of power among users, their

questiontext.text: Social media fundamentally changes the balance of power among users, their communities, and organizations.

name.text: q054 In social customer relationship management, relationships between organizat

questiontext.text: In social customer relationship management, relationships between organizations and customers are fixed.

name.text: q055 In social customer relationship management, since the relationships between

questiontext.text: In social customer relationship management, since the relationships between organizations and customers emerge from joint activity, customers have as much control as companies.

name.text: q056 Traditional customer relationship management (CRM) flies in the face of str

questiontext.text: Traditional customer relationship management (CRM) flies in the face of structured and controlled processes of social CRM.

name.text: q057 eBay often solicits customers to provide feedback on their eBay experience;

questiontext.text: eBay often solicits customers to provide feedback on their eBay experience; this is an example of crowdsourcing.

name.text: q058 Social media is widely used in business-to-business relationships and not i

questiontext.text: Social media is widely used in business-to-business relationships and not in business-to-customer relationships.

name.text: q059 Operations use social media to improve communication channels with their cu

questiontext.text: Operations use social media to improve communication channels with their customers, but not within an organization.

name.text: q060 Social media is increasingly used for finding employee prospects.

questiontext.text: Social media is increasingly used for finding employee prospects.

name.text: q061 Use of social media to recruit and evaluate potential employees is prohibit

questiontext.text: Use of social media to recruit and evaluate potential employees is prohibited.

name.text: q062 Social media sites that become too defensive can be perceived as promulgati

questiontext.text: Social media sites that become too defensive can be perceived as promulgating (i.e., promoting) an unpopular management message.

name.text: q063 What was the purpose of traditional customer relationship management (CRM)?

questiontext.text: What was the purpose of traditional customer relationship management (CRM)?

graderinfo.text: In the past, organizations controlled their relationships with customers using structured processes and related information systems. In fact, the primary purpose of traditional CRM was to manage customer touches. Traditional CRM ensured that an organization spoke to customers with one voice and that it controlled the messages, the offers, and even the support that customers received based on the value of each particular customer.

name.text: q064 Explain the social customer relationship management (CRM) process.

questiontext.text: Explain the social customer relationship management (CRM) process.

graderinfo.text: Social CRM is a dynamic, social media-based CRM process. The relationships between organizations and customers emerge in a dynamic process as both parties create and process content. In addition to the traditional forms of promotion, employees in an organization create wikis, blogs, discussion lists, frequently asked questions, sites for user reviews and commentary, and other dynamic content. Customers search this content, contribute reviews and commentary, ask more questions, create user groups, and so forth. With social CRM, each customer crafts his or her own relationship with the company.

name.text: q065 What is the difference between traditional customer relationship management

questiontext.text: What is the difference between traditional customer relationship management (CRM) and social customer relationship management (CRM)?

graderinfo.text: In social CRM, because relationships emerge from a joint activity, customers have as much control as companies. This characteristic is an anathema to traditional sales managers who want control over what a customer is reading, seeing, and hearing about a company and its products. Further, traditional CRM is centered on lifetime value; customers who are likely to generate the most business get the most attention and have the most impact on the organization. But, with social CRM, a customer who spends 10 cents but who is an effective reviewer, commentator, or blogger can have more influence than a quiet customer who purchases $10 million a year. Such imbalance is incomprehensible to traditional sales managers.

name.text: q066 Being linked to a network of highly regarded contacts is a form of ________

questiontext.text: Being linked to a network of highly regarded contacts is a form of ________.

name.text: q067 Which of the following statements is TRUE of social capital?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of social capital?

answer.text: Social capital is an investment in human knowledge and skills for future profit.
The value of social capital is determined by the number of relationships in a social network.
Social capital can be gained by limiting the number of friends.
Being linked into social networks undermines a professional's image and position in an organization.

name.text: q068 A person gains social capital by ________.

questiontext.text: A person gains social capital by ________.

answer.text: removing people who have less social capital

name.text: q069 Capital is defined as the investment of resources for future profit.

questiontext.text: Capital is defined as the investment of resources for future profit.

name.text: q070 Social capital is investment in human knowledge and skills for future profi

questiontext.text: Social capital is investment in human knowledge and skills for future profit.

name.text: q071 Being linked into social networks reinforces a professional's identity, ima

questiontext.text: Being linked into social networks reinforces a professional's identity, image, and position in an organization or industry.

name.text: q072 A social networking user gains social capital by adding more friends and by

questiontext.text: A social networking user gains social capital by adding more friends and by strengthening relationships with existing friends.

name.text: q073 Humans have social capital, whereas organizations do not have social capita

questiontext.text: Humans have social capital, whereas organizations do not have social capital.

name.text: q074 To an organization, the strength of a relationship is the likelihood that a

questiontext.text: To an organization, the strength of a relationship is the likelihood that an entity in the relationship will do something that benefits the organization.

name.text: q075 According to business literature, describe three types of capital that are

questiontext.text: According to business literature, describe three types of capital that are used.

graderinfo.text: Business literature describes three types of capital: traditional, human, and social. Karl Marx defined capital as the investment of resources for future profit. This traditional definition refers to investments into resources such as factories, machines, manufacturing equipment, and the like. In comparison, human capital is the investment in human knowledge and skills for future profit. By taking this class, people are investing in their own human capital. In other words, they are investing their money and time to obtain knowledge that they hope will differentiate them from other workers and ultimately give them a wage premium in the workforce. According to Nan Lin, social capital is investment in social relations with the expectation of returns in a marketplace.

name.text: q076 What is social capital?

questiontext.text: What is social capital?

graderinfo.text:
According to Nan Lin, social capital is investment in social relations with the expectation of returns in a marketplace. One can see social capital at work in one's personal life. They strengthen their social relationships when they help someone get a job, set a friend up on a date, or introduce a friend to someone famous. They weaken their social relationships by continually freeloading, declining requests for help, or failing to spend time with friends.
In one's professional life, they are investing in their social capital when they attend a business function for the purpose of meeting people and reinforcing relationships. Similarly, one can use social media to increase their social capital by recommending or endorsing someone on LinkedIn, liking a picture on Facebook, retweeting a tweet, or commenting on an Instagram picture.

name.text: q077 According to Nan Lin, how do people benefit from social capital?

questiontext.text: According to Nan Lin, how do people benefit from social capital?

graderinfo.text:
According to Nan Lin, people benefit from social capital in four ways:
1. Information
2. Influence
3. Social credentials
4. Personal reinforcement

First, relationships in social networks can provide information about opportunities, alternatives, problems, and other factors important to business professionals. Second, social networks provide an opportunity to influence decision makers at one's employer or in other organizations that are critical to their success. Third, being linked to a network of highly regarded contacts is a form of social credential. One can bask in the glory of those with whom they are connected. Finally, being linked into social networks reinforces a professional's identity, image, and position in an organization or industry.

name.text: q078 Web surfers cannot filter out advertising content.

questiontext.text: Web surfers cannot filter out advertising content.

name.text: q079 Conversion rate measures the frequency that someone who clicks on an ad mak

questiontext.text: Conversion rate measures the frequency that someone who clicks on an ad makes a purchase, "likes" a site, or takes some other action desired by an advertiser.

name.text: q080 Why do advertisers like digital advertising?

questiontext.text: Why do advertisers like digital advertising?

graderinfo.text: Advertisers like digital ads because unlike traditional media such as newspapers, users can respond directly to these ads by clicking on them. By running an ad in the print version of the Wall Street Journal, one has no idea of who responds to that ad and how strongly, but by placing an ad for that same product in the newspaper's online version, one will soon know the percentage of viewers who clicked that ad and what action they took next. The ability to track these statistics led to development of the pay-per-click revenue model, in which advertisers display ads to potential customers for free, and then get paid when a customer clicks on the ad.

name.text: q081 A ________ is a statement that delineates employees' rights and responsibil

questiontext.text: A ________ is a statement that delineates employees' rights and responsibilities in an organization.

name.text: q082 Which of the following statements is TRUE of social networking problems?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of social networking problems?

answer.text: Responses to problematic content are best reserved for instances where it has caused an organization to do something positive.
Inappropriate contributions that contain obscene or otherwise inappropriate content should be ignored indefinitely.
The product development team should not receive criticisms posted on a social networking site.
If problematic content represents reasonable criticism of the organization's products, the best response is to delete it.

name.text: q083 Patronizing responses to comments from content contributors can generate a

questiontext.text: Patronizing responses to comments from content contributors can generate a ________.

name.text: q084 The first step that any organization should take to manage the risk of empl

questiontext.text: The first step that any organization should take to manage the risk of employee communication is to develop and publicize a social media policy.

name.text: q085 If a reasoned, non-defensive response generates continued and unreasonable

questiontext.text: If a reasoned, non-defensive response generates continued and unreasonable user-generated content from that same source, it is best for an organization to delete it.

name.text: q086 Explain the major sources of user-generated content problems.

questiontext.text: Explain the major sources of user-generated content problems.

graderinfo.text: When a business participates in a social network or opens its site to a user-generated content (UGC), it opens itself to misguided people who post junk unrelated to the site's purpose. Crackpots may also use the network or UGC site as a way of expressing passionately held views about unrelated topics, such as UFOs, government cover-ups, fantastic conspiracy theories, and so forth. As of the possibility of such content, organizations should regularly monitor the site and remove objectionable material immediately. Unfavorable reviews are another risk. Research indicates that customers are sophisticated enough to know that few, if any, products are perfect. Most customers want to know the disadvantages of a product before purchasing it so they can determine if those disadvantages are important for their application. Mutinous movements are an extension of bad reviews.

name.text: q087 How should one respond to social networking problems?

questiontext.text: How should one respond to social networking problems?

graderinfo.text:
The first task in managing social networking risk is to know the sources of potential problems and to monitor sites for problematic content. Once such content is found, however, organizations must have a plan for creating an organization's response. Three possibilities are:
1. Leave it
2. Respond to it
3. Delete it

If the problematic content represents reasonable criticism of the organization's products or services, the best response may be to leave it where it is. Such criticism indicates that the site is not just a shill for the organization, but contains legitimate user content.
A second alternative is to respond to the problematic content. However, this alternative is dangerous. If the response could be construed in any way as patronizing or insulting to the content contributor, the response can enrage the community and generate a strong backlash. In most cases, responses are best reserved for when the problematic content has caused the organization to do something positive as a result. If a reasoned, nondefensive response generates continued and unreasonable UGC from that same source, it is best for the organization to do nothing.
Deleting content should be reserved for contributions that are inappropriate because they are contributed by crackpots, because they have nothing to do with the site, or because they contain obscene or otherwise inappropriate content. However, deleting legitimate negative comments can also result in a strong user backlash.

name.text: q088 ________ in the context of management means loss of control of employees.

questiontext.text: ________ in the context of management means loss of control of employees.

name.text: q089 Chief Digital Officer (CDO) is a position responsible for developing and ma

questiontext.text: Chief Digital Officer (CDO) is a position responsible for developing and managing innovative social media programs.

name.text: q091 In the context of management, transcendence means loss of control of employ

questiontext.text: In the context of management, transcendence means loss of control of employees.

questiontext.text: Social media is a convergence of disciplines.

name.text: q093 Larger organizations only use external social media platforms.

questiontext.text: Larger organizations only use external social media platforms.

questiontext.text: Social CRM is not a dynamic social media process.

questiontext.text: The primary risk of ________ is the loss of control.

questiontext.text: ________ allow sales to scale to levels not possible in the past because of the many simultaneous connections.

name.text: q101 Social capital can never be overspent.

questiontext.text: Social capital can never be overspent.

name.text: q102 ________ measures the frequency that someone who clicks on an ad makes a pu

questiontext.text: ________ measures the frequency that someone who clicks on an ad makes a purchase.

name.text: q103 James decides to create an app that keeps up with miles on the car. He offe

questiontext.text: James decides to create an app that keeps up with miles on the car. He offers the app for free, but if a user wants a report sent to them they have to upgrade the app. This revenue model is referred to as ________.

name.text: q104 All of these are revenue models for social media EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: All of these are revenue models for social media EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q105 Explain how a company can raise the value of their site with user contribut

questiontext.text: Explain how a company can raise the value of their site with user contributions.

graderinfo.text: The phrase use increases value means that the more people use a site, the more value the site has, and the more people that visit it. Furthermore, the more value a site has, the more its existing users will return. This phenomenon led to the rise of user comments and reviews, blogging, and, within a few years, social media. Ad revenue, as a result, increased because more people were seeing, and clicking on, more ads on their favorite sites.

name.text: q106 Users do not click on mobile ads.

questiontext.text: Users do not click on mobile ads.

name.text: q107 Who is the product since social media is free?

questiontext.text: Who is the product since social media is free?

answer.text: There is no product in social media.

name.text: q108 Since users expect for social media to be free, what is one of the biggest

questiontext.text: Since users expect for social media to be free, what is one of the biggest dilemmas for social media?

answer.text: How do companies monetize the product?
How do the companies keep every safe?
What to do about fake news?

name.text: q109 All of the followings are problems from external sources when dealing with

questiontext.text: All of the followings are problems from external sources when dealing with the risk of inappropriate content EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q110 Social media can directly affect the ability of the organization to secure

questiontext.text: Social media can directly affect the ability of the organization to secure their information resources.

name.text: q111 Describe the internal risks from social media when using social media.

questiontext.text: Describe the internal risks from social media when using social media.

graderinfo.text: First, the use of social media can directly affect the ability of the organization to secure their information resources. Employees using social media can unintentionally (or intentionally) leak information about intellectual property, new marketing campaigns, future products, potential layoffs, budget woes, product flaws, or upcoming mergers. Second, employees may inadvertently increase corporate liability when they use social media. Finally, the increased use of social media can be a threat to employee productivity. Posts, tweets, pins, likes, comments, and endorsements all take time.

name.text: q122 What is one way organizations increase social capital?

questiontext.text: What is one way organizations increase social capital?

answer.text: offering coupons on their social media site.

name.text: q123 What guidelines should one consider when using social networking profession

questiontext.text: What guidelines should one consider when using social networking professionally?

graderinfo.text: So, when you use social networking professionally, consider these guidelines. You gain social capital by adding more friends and by strengthening the relationships you have with existing friends. Further, you gain more social capital by adding friends and strengthening relationships with people who control resources that are important to you. Such calculations may seem cold, impersonal, and possibly even phony. When applied to the recreational use of social networking, they may be. But when you use social networking for professional purposes, keep them in mind. As a business professional, it's important to understand what social capital is, why it's valuable, and how you can benefit from it.

name.text: q124 ________ is a location service that allows applications to know when a user

questiontext.text: ________ is a location service that allows applications to know when a user has crossed a virtual fence and then triggers an automated action.

name.text: q125 Companies can use ________ to target customers with ads when they are physi

questiontext.text: Companies can use ________ to target customers with ads when they are physically on company premises.

name.text: q126 What is geofencing? Provide an example of how can a company use geofencing?

questiontext.text: What is geofencing? Provide an example of how can a company use geofencing?

graderinfo.text: Examples may vary. Geofencing is a location service that allows applications to know when a user has crossed a virtual fence (specific location) and then triggers an automated action. For example, suppose a user enters a coffee shop and her phone automatically connects to the free Wi-Fi. An app on her phone recognizes the coffee shop wireless network and pushes an in-store ad to her phone for a free donut. Her phone might also be able to use her cellular network to determine her location, and she could see that there's a sale on shoes at the outdoor mall down the street.
